bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to the Smithsonian Institution, May 5, 1924

div1.p: [Carter] requests a reprint of an article on Mayan glyphs.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to the Smithsonian Institution, May 5, 1924
div1.opener:
Book
Mauja (Morlay)
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
May 5, 1924.
Smithsonian Institution,
10th. and B Sts. N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
I was informed by Dr. Sylvanus G. Morley, during his recent
stay in Washington, that I could get the following one of his re-
prints from yourselves:

“An Introduction to the Study of Maya Glyphs,”
Sylvanus G. Morley,
Bulletin 57: Bureau of American Ethnology,
Smithsonian Institution.

I shall be very grateful for it as I need it in connection
with a History of Yellow Fever I am writing for the International
Health Board of the Rockefeller Foundation.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Address
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N.W.,
Washington, D. C.
